control.name: Step 1
control.descrp:
Step 1
Measure and record the mass of the strip of magnesium.

control.name: Step 2
control.descrp:
Step 2
Fold the magnesium ribbon to make a small compact bundle that can be held by a copper cage.

control.name: Step 3
control.descrp:
Step 3
Wrap the fine copper wire all around the magnesium, making a cage to hold it, but leaving 30 mm to 50 mm at each end of the wire free for a handle.

control.name: Step 4
control.descrp:
Step 4
Carefully pour 10 mL to 15 mL of the hydrochloric acid into the graduated cylinder.

control.name: Step 5
control.descrp:
Step 5
Slowly fill the graduated cylinder to the brim with water from a beaker. As you fill the cylinder, pour slowly down the side of the cylinder to minimize mixing of the water with the acid at the bottom. In this way, the liquid at the top of the cylinder is relatively pure water and the acid remains at the bottom.

control.name: Step 6
control.descrp:
Step 6
Half-fill the large beaker with water.

control.name: Step 7
control.descrp:
Step 7
Bend the copper wire handle through the holes in the stopper so that the cage holding the magnesium is positioned about 10 mm below the bottom of the stopper.

control.name: Step 8
control.descrp:
Step 8
Insert the stopper into the graduated cylinder; the liquid in the cylinder will overflow a little. Cover the holes in the stopper with your finger. Working quickly, invert the cylinder, and immediately lower it into the large beaker so that the stopper is below the surface of the water before you remove your finger from the stopper holes.

control.name: Step 9
control.descrp:
Step 9
Observe the reaction, then wait about 5 minutes after the bubbling stops to allow the contents of the graduated cylinder to reach room tempertaure.

control.name: Step 10
control.descrp:
Step 10
Raise or lower the graduated cylinder so that the level of liquid inside the beaker is the same as the level of liquid inside the graduated cylinder. (This equalizes the gas pressure in the cylinder with the pressure of the air in the room.)

control.name: Step 11
control.descrp:
Step 11
Measure and record the volume of gas in the graduated cylinder.

control.name: Step 12
control.descrp:
Step 12
Record the laboratory (ambient) temperature and pressure.

The atmospheric pressure on the day the experiment was performed was 101.62 kPa.

control.name: Step 13
control.descrp:
Step 13
The liquids in this investigation may be poured down the sink, but rinse the sink with lots of water.
